p: We did not find significant differences for the lox gene among fish under different conditions. Lysyl oxidase (LOX) catalyzes the formation of lysine-derived cross-links in collagen and elastin and it is involved in several other biological functions (e.g. development, tumor suppression, cell motility and cellular senescence) [ 74]. Therefore, the absence of differences may be due to the fact that the lox gene is vital during development and in atypical cell functioning [ 74].
